before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"de3p4","text":"Ensure all consumables are in stock and all compounds and reagents are freshly prepared","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

85393.section: Using MultiQuant to evaluate Analyst acquired LC-MS/MS data
85393.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fcauh","text":"Create a result file in MultiQuant 3.0.3 by opening the software, selecting an LC-MS/MS data file acquired in Analyst software, that has been acquired following extraction using a protocol with carefully designed calibration curve and known calibration units. Select some or all of the samples in the batch of the file, selecting the processing method (as above) and allow the software to evaluate the data, before defining calibration ranges and assessing integration of peaks. To do this, follow these steps","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7j929","text":"In MultiQuant in the batch of samples define sample type - Blanks, Double Blanks, Standards, QCs and Unknowns (samples) and Solvents. Add known amounts to standards and QCs according to the Etraction protocol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1cgdt","text":"Insert standard curve values and QC values in 'actual amount' column, according to the calibration table and QC table. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5ls9l","text":"Check all peaks have integrated and that there are peak areas for each analyte - reassign retention time if it is not quite picking the peak and use Metric plots to assess peak area and retention time to ensure correct peaks have been integrated","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":null,"entityRanges":null,"data":{}},{"key":"6mx2l","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"E7A0327C345711EEAFD10A58A9FEAC02","height":240,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"6o0fl\",\"text\":\"Metric plot selected along with Calibration curve and identified peak.\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/jpeg","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"IMG_7373.jpeg","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m8ypbm8pf.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m8ymbm8pf.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m8ynbm8pf.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m8ykbm8pf.webp","width":320}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eradm","text":"Check calibration curves for accuracy (\u003c20%) and exclude those points that are outwith. Ensure there are a minmum of 6 points in each calibration curve and that they have a regression coefficient R\u003e0.99","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

85393.section: Transferring MultiQuant alphanumeric data into Excel to summarise results
85393.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1f9kk","text":"On the 'Raw Data' tab select 'filter' in the top menu of Excle and select the first analyte in the list (alphabetical). Copy this analyte excel data into the new tab and rename the tab with the analyte name. Repeat with all analytes until you have an excel spreadsheet with the following tabs - Raw Data; Analyte 1; Analyte 2, etcâ€¦.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

85393.section: Transferring MultiQuant alphanumeric data into Excel to summarise results
85393.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4ae2v","text":"In each of the separate tabs for the analytes - go into the tabs and rename the 'calculated amount' column on the Analyte tab to '[Analyte name] ng' and rename in the 2nd Analyte tab to '[2nd Analyte name] ng' (use the real analyte name!)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

85393.section: Transferring MultiQuant alphanumeric data into Excel to summarise results
85393.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"f3tr9","text":"Create a new tab and name it 'Summary'. Copy the first three columns from the first Analyte tab, which contains sample details and calibration level details. Paste into the new tab. Then return to the Analyte tab and copy the '[Analyte name] ng' column. Repeat this copying of the [Analyte name] ng column until all analytes in the MultiQaunt file and hence the excel file, have been copied. This results in a Summary table that is the major results of the analysis in terms of concentration","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

85393.section: Using MultiQuant to evaluate Analyst acquired LC-MS/MS data
85393.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"dij6v","text":"Select a data file (*.wiff) of a batch of data that includes calibration standards and unknowns, collected in Analyst and select all samples and standards or a selection. Click Next.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

85393.section: Using MultiQuant to evaluate Analyst acquired LC-MS/MS data
85393.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fmm9n","text":"Select the processing method created in MultiQuant that is appropriate to the data file (MultiQuant quantitation method file). Click Next.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

85393.section: Using MultiQuant to evaluate Analyst acquired LC-MS/MS data
85393.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9mkk7","text":"Save the file (a result file) with the file naming convention of the data file (yyymmdd_Exxxx_Analyte_initials) before beginning to process the data.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

85393.section: Transferring MultiQuant alphanumeric data into Excel to summarise results
85393.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3rri1","text":"Copy the alphanumeric data of all peak areas and calculated amounts from MultiQuant result file into Microsoft Excel","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

85393.section: Transferring MultiQuant alphanumeric data into Excel to summarise results
85393.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"alut9","text":"Open Microsoft Excel and create a new spreadsheet and name it using the same file naming convention as used for the MultiQuant result file and name the first tab â€˜Raw Dataâ€™","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

85393.section: Transferring MultiQuant alphanumeric data into Excel to summarise results
85393.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9165c","text":"If the calibration curve units are ng and the sample extracted has been a volume, add a column ahead of all Analyte concentrations, include the volume extracted for each sample and then use this column to calculate the ng/mL amount by dividing the â€˜calculated amountâ€™ by the volume (uL) and multiply by 1000 to give the ng/mL amount of each analyte. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

85393.section: Transferring MultiQuant alphanumeric data into Excel to summarise results
85393.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6ilmh","text":"If the calibration curve units are ng and the sample extracted has been a mass of tissue, add a column ahead of all Analyte concentrations, include the volume extracted for each sample and then use this column to calculate the ng/g. amount by dividing the â€˜calculated amountâ€™ by the mass in g to give the ng/g amount of each analyte","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

85393.section: Transferring MultiQuant alphanumeric data into Excel to summarise results
85393.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bi4bb","text":"If the sample analysed was urine, it is necessary to correct the amount of analyte detected by the creatinine concentration (measured elsewhere) OR if the 24 hour volume of urine is known this can be used to express the amount of analyte/day by calculating as a ratio of the extracted volume/day volume.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

85393.section: Create a processing method in MultiQuant using an acquired data file
85393.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"eoh0","text":"Using a data file created in Analyst, with known analyte mass transitions and retention times, build a Processing method that integrates peaks with sufficient time window to integrate the peaks but not too wide that it chooses incorrect peaks. Save the processing file name in MultiQuant and include details in the name that describe the column used and analytes measured as these are critical method details.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"ejd13","text":"Steroid hormones, including progesterone, testosterone and corticosterone, play a critical role in\ngrowth, development, reproductive function and sexual differentiation.  Steroid production is controlled in the adrenals via the hypothalamic-pituitary-adrenal axis and in the gonads by the hypothalamic-pituitary-gonadal axis, but steroids are also produced and metabolised in peripheral tissues such as adipose tissue.  Circulating steroids (blood levels) do not always reflect local steroid tissue levels. In studies of caloric restriction there are observed changes in steroids and there is interest in the role that bone marrow adipose tissue plays1. Thus, to understand mechanisms of caloric restriction it is valuable to measure tissue levels of steroids as well as circulating levels of steroids.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":651,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b3tld","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"83oke","text":"Immunoassays can be used to measure steroids but they lack specificity, limited to one or two steroids, and suffer from cross-reactivity at low concentrations. Tandem mass spectrometry methods coupled with chromatographic separation are considered the gold standard analytical technique for steroid analysis, such as LC-MS/MS, with the added benefit of enabling simultaneous analysis of multiple steroids.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2rql9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ehkgb","text":"Here we have improved upon existing murine steroid liquid chromatography tandem mass spectrometry (LC-MS/MS) methods2 for the quantitation of four steroids in small samples to investigate the role of steroids in caloric restriction - specifically corticosterone, 11-dehydrocorticosterone, testosterone and progesterone - in bone marrow and plasma. Bone marrow is homogenised and then homogenate samples and plasma samples (~50 ÂµL) were extracted by automated 96-well supported liquid extraction (SLE), using dichloromethane and isopropanol as an organic solvent, carried out on a Biotage Extrahera automated sample handler.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":116,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"en7q0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fdhkj","text":"Extracted steroids were separated on a Shimadzu Nexera uHPLC with gradient elution on a Kinetex C18 column (150 x 3 mm; 2.6 Âµm) and a mobile phase of methanol and water (0.1% formic acid). The run time was 16 minutes, followed by mass spectral analysis on an AB Sciex 6500+ tandem quadrupole mass spectrometer operated in positive ionisation mode.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8ak64","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e542h","text":"This automated SLE-LC-MS/MS method has been used to analyse 4 steroids - corticosterone, progesterone and testosterone - in mouse plasma and bone marrow. Validation demonstrates that this method is sensitive, specific, and suitable for steroid measurement in mouse bone marrow (4-8 bones) and a low volume of mouse plasma (50 ÂµL), enabling investigation into tissue specific steroid levels and corresponding assessment of circulating steroid levels.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
ethics_statement: {"blocks":[{"key":"7ikr1","text":"All mouse studies were approved by the University of Edinburgh Animal Welfare and Ethical Review Board and were done under project licenses granted by the UK Home Office. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"1l5ep","text":"Ensure all training is up-to-date for operating the necessary laboratory instrumentation and equipment.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
keywords: steroid, steroid analysis, quantitative steroid measurement, LC-MS/MS, corticosterone, 11-dehydrocorticosterone, testosterone, progesterone, supported liquid extraction, mouse plasma, mouse bone marrow, bone marrow,mouse,tissue specific,tandem mass spectrometry,steroid mass spectrometry

protocol_references: {"blocks":[{"key":"e0u","text":"1.Cawthorn WP, Scheller EL, Parlee SD, Pham HA, Learman BS, Redshaw CM, Sulston RJ, Burr AA, Das AK, Simon BR, Mori H, Bree AJ, Schell B, Krishnan V, MacDougald OA. Expansion of Bone Marrow Adipose Tissue During Caloric Restriction Is Associated With Increased Circulating Glucocorticoids and Not With Hypoleptinemia. PMID: 26696121; PMCID: PMC4733126.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dbglg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dhh2s","text":"2. Quantitative analysis of 11-dehydrocorticosterone and corticosterone for preclinical studies by liquid chromatography/triple quadrupole mass spectrometry. PMID: 31677354; PMCID: PMC7540072.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"48v0v","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"eofgc","text":"Prepare 0.5 mL Eppendorf microtubes for all bone marrow samples by removing the bottom of a 0.5 mL microtube (Eppendorf) with a razor blade","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a5o7u","text":"Batch sizes of 20-40 bone marrow samples are most manageable. Isolate bone marrow (BM) from frozen (or fresh) tibia by doing the following:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2mk30","text":"Remove tibiae from freezer and transfer frozen tibiae from dry ice onto wet ice prior to cutting.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9gcpf","text":"Use a razor blade to cut off the proximal and distal ends of each tibia","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a12ep","text":"Place each cut tibia into a cut-off 0.5 mL microtube, to keep the bone upright, and add this tibia in a 0.5 mL microtube into a 2 mL microtube. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ah5vr","text":"Centrifuge the 2 mL cap-lock microtube and its contents in a microcentrifuge for . The BM pellet will collect at the base of the 2 mL microtube","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":80,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"968n2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"8000","duration":60,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"4","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":1324}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8s8j9","text":"Record the mass of each BM pellet, using an analytical balance, prior to homogenisation. Multiple BM pellets can be combined at this point. (e.g. 2, 4 , 6 or 8 BM pellets can be homogenised together).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ci3ig","text":"Add   to the bone marrow in the 2 mL microtube","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7p2ag","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"500","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"acetonitrile w/ 0.01% formic acid","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4kvnv","text":"Add a 5 mm stainless steel metal bead into a 2 mL microtube, cap securely and homogenise in the Qiagen bead mill homogeniser at 30 Hz for   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":138,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bgb00","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":30,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a2hvj","text":"Remove and transfer the homogenisation tube containing the homogenate to the freezer for   at   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":89,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":94,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9juh6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":3600,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-20","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cedlg","text":"Remove the homogenate tube from the freezer, centrifuge for   at 16,100 rcf","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":60,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"akk33","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4bpd1","text":"Transfer the homogenate to a clean, labelled glass vial using a glass pipette","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fhr40","text":"Add another aliquot of   to the bone marrow pellet, vortex and centrifuge for   at 16,100 rcf","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":23,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":78,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ecf7b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"500","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"acetonitrile w/ 0.01% formic acid","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"B4683D37CF5111EE978B0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"11qch","text":"Transfer the supernatant from the homogenisation tube and add it to the first supernatant in the glass tube. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1nn0f","text":"Reduced the supernatant to dryness under nitrogen at   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":53,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6f1fu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"40","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"abcr0","text":"Resuspend the dried down homogenate supernatant of  by adding   prior to preparation of calibration standards (4), working internal standard (5) and then supported liquid extraction (See point 7) of steroids","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":50,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":62,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2js72","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"sample","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"blocks":null,"entityMap":null}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"200","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"water","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bpm0o","text":"Prepare 100 Âµg/mL stock solutions of each steroid - corticosterone (B), 11-dehydrocorticosterone (A), testosterone (T) and progesterone (P4) in 1.75 m","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"daoqe","text":"Prepare a mixed stock of the 4 steroids - B, A, T, P4 - by using 100 Âµg/mL stock solutions. Do this by adding 50 ÂµL x 100 Âµg/mL B, 50 ÂµL x 100 Âµg/mL A, 50 ÂµL x 100 Âµg/mL T and 50 ÂµL x 100 Âµg/mL P4 + 800 ÂµL methanol to give a 5 Âµg/mL stock. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":225,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4l7e4","text":"Dilute the 5 Âµg/mL stock Mixed STOCK by 1:10 dilution (100 ÂµL x 5 Âµg/mL + 900 ÂµL methanol ) to give 500 ng/mL stock","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":11,"length":14},{"style":"bold","offset":100,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"993d6","text":"Dilute the 500 ng/mL mixed STOCK by 1:10 dilution (100 ÂµL x 500 ng/mL + 900 ÂµL methanol ) to give 50 ng/mL stock","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":11,"length":10},{"style":"bold","offset":98,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"89qjd","text":"Dilute the 50 ng/mL mixed STOCK by 1:10 dilution (100 ÂµL x 5 Âµg/mL + 900 ÂµL methanol ) to give 5 ng/mL stock","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":11,"length":9},{"style":"bold","offset":95,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fieij","text":"Dilute the 5 ng/mL Mixed STOCK by 1:10 dilution (100 ÂµL x 5 Âµg/mL + 900 ÂµL methanol ) to give 500 pg/mL stock","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":11,"length":8},{"style":"bold","offset":94,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3l73s","text":"Dilute the 500 pg/mL Mixed STOCK by 1:10 dilution (  x 5 Âµg/mL +  methanol ) to give 50 pg/mL stock   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":11,"length":10},{"style":"bold","offset":85,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":51,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":65,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":100,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8pita","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"100","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"900","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"2":{"type":"gotostep","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"233B4BAB4705478DBADF37C726EED6D4","step_guid":"547CB206968749BDB7FB15A4E3869291","title":""}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"84dj1","text":"Prepare 100 Âµg/mL solutions of each isotopically labelled internal standard (d8-corticosterone, 13C3-testosterone and d9-progesterone) in methanol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":8,"length":20},{"style":"sup","offset":96,"length":2},{"style":"sub","offset":99,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b25bu","text":"Prepare a mixed 5 Âµg/mL Internal Standard mix stock solution of the three isotopically labelled steroids by adding   x 100 Âµg/mL d8-corticosterone,   x 100 Âµg/mL 13C3-testosterone and  x 100 Âµg/mL d9-progesterone to  methanol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":10,"length":13},{"style":"sup","offset":162,"length":2},{"style":"sub","offset":165,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":115,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":148,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":183,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":215,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"d0eqn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"25","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"25","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"25","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"3":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"425","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"edfh1","text":"Prepare a 5 ng/mL Working Internal Standard solution by taking 10 ÂµL x 5 Âµg/mL Int Std Mix + 1990 ÂµL methanol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":10,"length":33}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Supported liquid extraction of steroids from calibration standards and samples
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"c2uq4","text":"Transfer 200 ÂµL of prepared calibration standards, bone marrow homogenate and mouse plasma from glass culture tubes into a 2 mL deep well 96-well collection plate (Biotage), prepared in Microsoft Excel template (see Files) and following a plate map design as below - ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2jo61","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8nqvi","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"height":281,"id":445651,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"72k5r\",\"text\":\"Plate Map - Column-wise plate layout for automated Supported Liquid Extraction on an Extrahera liquid handling robot (Biotage, Sweden)\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[{\"style\":\"bold\",\"offset\":0,\"length\":10}],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/png","originalFile":{},"original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/pvgxbm8pf.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/pvgvbm8pf.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/pvgwbm8pf.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/pvgubm8pf.webp","width":550}}}}

steps.section: Supported liquid extraction of steroids from calibration standards and samples
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"akrj6","text":"Using a multi-step pipette enrich the plate containing calibration standards with IS by adding  x 5 ng/mL Working Internal Standard into each calibration standard, including 0 std and each sample (bone homogenate and mouse plasma), except for the Double blank and solvent blank.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":96,"length":35}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":95,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"dnj1a","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"20","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

steps.section: Supported liquid extraction of steroids from calibration standards and samples
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"dfbdk","text":"Using the Extrahera liquid handling robot, set up with an SLE400 extraction plate and a deep well extraction plate, aliquot 200 ÂµL  ammonium hydroxide in water into each well of the 96-well plate. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":131,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1ir7r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"0.5","error_concentration":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":21}}}}

steps.section: Supported liquid extraction of steroids from calibration standards and samples
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"47avg","text":"Transfer   of liquid from each well (containing sample and the diluent,  ammonium hydroxide) into a 400 ÂµL volume Supported Liquid Extraction plate (SLE400), pre-placed into the deck on the Extrahera, with a deep well Waters 2 mL deep well collection plate below, pre-labelled with the batch details and date of extraction.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":9,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":72,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5f870","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"400","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"0.5","error_concentration":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":21}}}}

steps.section: Supported liquid extraction of steroids from calibration standards and samples
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"abccs","text":"Allow the diluted sample to adsorb onto the SLE extraction bed for   before eluting with   x  98:2 (v/v) dichloromethane/isopropanol and repeating twice more, each time collecting the eluent into the collection plate","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":67,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":89,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2cge2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"600","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4ivf","text":"Resuspend in   x 70:30 water/methanol, seal the plate with a zone-free plate seal and shake on ThermoShaker for   at  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":13,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":112,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":117,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cidqm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"100","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"2":{"type":"shaker","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":0,"error_shaker":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"shaker":false,"temperature":false},"shaker":"300","start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":33}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a2b54","text":"Set up an acquisition batch in Analyst software using the electronic file of the calibration standards and sample list. Set to inject 10 ÂµL per sample and use a method of chromatographic separation as described in step 16 and 17 and mass spectrometer settings as outlined in steps 18 and 19.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2qt02","text":"Set up the Shimadzu Nexera X2 liquid chromatography system and fit with a Phenomenex Krud Katcher and a Phenomenex 150 x 3 mm; 2.6 Âµm Kinetex C18 liquid chromatography column, using mobile phase A - water with 0.1% formic acid and mobile phase B - methanol with 0.1% formic acid at 0.5 mL/min and  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":297,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7j1r2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"40","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9sc45","text":"Remove mouse plasma samples from the freezer and defrost on ice. Label up glass culture tubes  with mouse sample IDs and aliquot   of each   into labelled glass tubes, alongside bone marrow.
